greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number T(n,k) of 2n-length strings of balanced parentheses of exactly k different types that are introduced in ascending order; triangle T(n,k), n>=0, 0<=k<=n, read by rows.
comment: In general, column k>0 is asymptotic to (4*k)^n / (k!*sqrt(Pi)*n^(3/2)). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Jun 01 2015
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..140, flattened
maple: ctln:= proc(n) option remember; binomial(2*n, n)/(n+1) end:
A:= proc(n, k) option remember; k^n*ctln(n) end:
mathematica: A[n_, k_] := A[n, k] = k^n*CatalanNumber[n]; T[0, 0] = 1; T[n_, k_] := Sum[A[n, k-i]*(-1)^i/((k-i)!*i!), {i, 0, k}]; Table[T[n, k], {n, 0, 10}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 11 2017, adapted from Maple *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Mar 23 2015
